ygData.subject: General advice for soloing
ygData.msgSnippet: Greetings all! I purchased everquest with the knowledge that I would have to solo most of the time due to odd playing hours, family, yadda yadda etc.
ygData.messageBody:
Greetings all!<br><br>I purchased everquest with
the knowledge that I would have to solo most of the
time due to odd playing hours, family, yadda yadda
etc. etc. I decided on a Barb Shaman because I thought
they seemed like they could go it alone pretty well.
Recently strange and unforseen events have made me rethink
my decision and I am looking for some advice from my
fellow players (see sob story below)<br><br>I was once a
non-twinked lvl 15 Shaman until I had a run in with an angry
Undead Reaver on my way up to Highhold Pass. Anyway,
during the fight, I was somehow knocked over the edge
and fell to my untimely demise. When I returned, I
was unable to locate my corpse. I found a friendly
Bard to help me locate, but still no good. I
petitioned for help and got no response (suprise, suprise).
Well to make a long story short I am now a naked lvl
14 Barbarian Shaman with 30pp in the bank and a
choice to make.<br><br>My question is should I continue
with the Shaman or maybe start anew with a different
class that might be easier to solo?
